questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic complaining of frontal headaches. His medical history is significant for complex partial seizures. He describes a typical seizure beginning with 20 seconds of involuntary orobuccal movements. This is followed by approximately 40 seconds during which he experiences altered consciousness. Notably, at the onset of his seizures, he reports a compelling and uncontrollable urge to repeatedly think of the word ‘Prashamsansan.’ He is unable to suppress this thought, which persists throughout the seizure episode. His neurological examination and routine blood work are unremarkable. An MRI of the brain shows no structural abnormalities. What is this phenomenon called?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Forced thinking
